name: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2011
description: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) is a computer-assisted telephone survey of 1200 Albertan adults. It is a portion of the 2011b Alberta Survey (doi:10.7939/DVN/10006) conducted by the Population Research Lab, and commissioned by PolicyWise for Children & Families (formerly the Alberta Centre for Child, Family and Community Research) using Alberta Health funding. Ten questions were asked relating to general knowledge about Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder; personal experience related to FASD; and attitudes concerning prevention. These metadata are also available through SAGE's searchable metadata website: http://sagemetadata.policywise.com/nada/index.php/catalog/4
spatialCoverage: Edmonton, Alberta; Calgary, Alberta; Rest of Alberta

distribution.name: Full_metadata_FASD2011.pdf
distribution.description: Contains the full metadata document for the 2011 FASD - What Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders survey. Includes element-level information
